required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

brief_summary.textblock: This study is a regulatory post-marketing surveillance in Japan, and it is a local prospective and observational study of women who are inserted Mirena for intrauterine contraception. The objective of this study is to assess safety and effectiveness of Mirena under real-life practice conditions. A total 550 patients will be recruited and followed for 5 years.

primary_outcome.measure: Incidence of adverse drug reactions and serious adverse events in women who are inserted Mirena
primary_outcome.time_frame: After Mirera insertion, up to 5 years

primary_outcome.measure: Incidence of adverse drug reactions, especially Pelvic inflammatory disease in women who are inserted Mirena
primary_outcome.time_frame: After Mirera insertion, up to 5 years

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence of adverse drug reactions in subpopulation in a variety of baseline data (such as demographic data, concomitant disease) and duration of Mirena
secondary_outcome.time_frame: After Mirera insertion, up to 5 years
After Mirera insertion, up to 5 years

secondary_outcome.measure: Released amount of Levonorgestrel [estimated from removed Mirena]
secondary_outcome.time_frame: After Mirera insertion, up to 5 years

intervention.description: Women inserted Mirena for intrauterine contraception.

study_pop.textblock: The target population of this study is women who patients who are inserted Mirena for intrauterine contraception. The study is expected to collect data of 550 women.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Women who are inserted Mirena for intrauterine contraception Exclusion Criteria:
- Women who are contraindicated based on the product label
